vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: Command injection vulnerability in the ping functionality due to unsanitized user input being passed directly to shell commands

semantic_details.description: The application directly concatenates user input with a shell command without proper sanitization, allowing command injection despite basic character filtering
scenario: Attacker inputs a malicious string like '127.0.0.1; cat /etc/passwd'
The basic character filtering can be bypassed using alternative syntax
Application concatenates this input directly into a shell command
Both the ping command and the injected command are executed with application privileges
